glsa.title: phpMyAdmin: SQL injection vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A SQL injection vulnerability has been discovered in phpMyAdmin.

background.p: phpMyAdmin is a free web-based database administration tool.

description.p: Richard Cunningham reported that phpMyAdmin uses the $_REQUEST variable of $_GET and $_POST as a source for its parameters.

impact.p: An attacker could entice a user to visit a malicious web application that sets an "sql_query" cookie and is hosted on the same domain as phpMyAdmin, and thereby conduct SQL injection attacks with the privileges of the user authenticating in phpMyAdmin afterwards.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
